meanings.definition: The action or process of reinforcing or strengthening something.
meanings.sent1: The reinforcement of the bridge made it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker added extra reinforcement to the foundation.
meanings.sent3: The reinforcement of the treehouse with extra nails made it sturdy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a reinforcement, giving him strength.
meanings.sent5: The reinforcement of the dam prevented it from breaking during the storm.

meanings.definition: An additional amount of material added to increase strength or support.
meanings.sent1: The builder used steel bars as reinforcement for the concrete.
meanings.sent2: The reinforcement of the wall with more bricks made it stable.
meanings.sent3: The reinforcement of the cake with extra frosting made it delicious.
meanings.sent4: His determination was a reinforcement that carried him through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The reinforcement of the roof with more tiles protected the house from rain.

meanings.definition: The act of encouraging or supporting a behavior or belief.
meanings.sent1: Positive reinforcement can help children learn better.
meanings.sent2: The reinforcement of her confidence by her friends boosted her spirits.
meanings.sent3: The reinforcement of the idea with examples made it easier to understand.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was a reinforcement of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The reinforcement of good habits leads to a healthier lifestyle.
